I highly recommend this anime if you want to have an ear to ear smile and feels after watching it. I really enjoyed this series and wouldnot even bother to rewatch it again someday.

Ore Monogatari is a 24 episode romantic comedy revolving around the big loveable giant Takeo Goda and his girlfriend Rinko Yamato. It shows there trials and tribulations in being a couple, with some bumps along the way. 
Story: 
When this anime first aired I was surprised at how the less attractive male would take leading role in place of the usual blonde and handsome male in every other shoujo, romantic comedy. Little to my surprise that Takeo would be the one with a heart of gold and a much more likeable personality compared to that of his best friend Makoto Sunakawa. 
However due to Takeo’sfreakishly large stature for his age he has trouble getting the girl he likes to return his feelings and them often falling for Sunakawa instead. After the process repeats itself for many years it would be safe to assume this would happen again after helping the kind and sweet Rinko Yamato. 


Making the assumption that Rinko likes Sunakawa, Takeo goes about trying to set the two up. Things stay this way before Sunakawa being the good friend he is and clears up the misunderstanding and helps get the two together. 


From there on out we go through their angst, lack of trust, other love interests for both Takeo and Rinko and other stories.  


Characters: 

Takeo Goda is our main star for the show. He has a large and muscular build despite being a first year at high school. People often mistake him for a criminal as seen in one episode where police approach him. Takeo has a kind personality and helps others who are in need of it without. The downside of his personality is his self-doubt from constant rejection, making the first few episodes of the series quite frustrating. 


Rinko Yamato is the main love interest and girlfriend of Takeo she is a sweet and nice girl who often likes to bake sweets for Takeo. After being attacked in the first episode Takeo came to her rescue and she developed a crush on him, even going as far as to track him down via police in order to see him again. I get the feeling that there may be more to her character than meets the eyes. 


Makoto Sunakawa is Takeo’s best friend. He has the prince charming look and the laid back personality to make girls think he’s cool. Sunakawa is often rejecting girls as they either say bad things about his best friend or has no connection with them whatsoever. Sunakawa was instrumental in getting Takeo and Rinko together and is often good to clear up misunderstanding both have for one another. 



Art: 

The art was really nice in this series; it had a lot of shiny and pretty colours to suit the romantic theme. Madhouse was the studio behind this, meaning of course that we’re unlikely to get a second season. 


Sound: 

The opening “Miraikei Answer” was a nice opening it was sweet and the visuals to go with it worked a treat. The ending song "Shiawase no Arika" was much better to my taste having a sharp vocals and a lovely guitar sound.  



Enjoyment:

I very much enjoyed this show. When I first saw it I instantly regarded my two best friends as Takeo and Goda as the personalities matched the characters in Ore Monogatari. The story was refreshing, telling it from the view of the less attractive best friend character. The comedy was entertaining and it gives me hope that even I can find love if my heart is good enough. The only flaws I could think of were the shows length, whilst I did enjoy its entirety I did think 24 episodes seemed like a lot. Another is the text that appeared above characters heads when they were thinking something and not saying it aloud, sorry to nit-pick, but I found that distracting. 



Overall: 

Ore Monogatari is a lovely show. Being a kind person with a golden personality is more than enough to get the girl of your dreams and this anime portrays that well. Characters are well developed, but leave me feeling there is more to be discovered about the trio of main characters. Story is good, although a bit longer than it needed to be. Art was good and had very pretty colours and nothing wrong with the animation either. There are few flaws in the show to mention. 


Overall I give Ore Monogatari a 7 out of 10. 


I don’t have any specific alternate recommendations as this show is similar to most other Romantic comedies out there.

Romance is in the air in this series!
Short Summary:
Gouda Takeo is a freshman in high school.
Who, however, does NOT look like the average high school student.
He spends his days with his childhood friend, Sunakawa, who is super popular with girls.
However one morning, on the train to school; Takeo saves a girl called Yamato from a molestor.
Could this be a sign of spring beginning for Takeo?
Let me just say; this anime is full on romance. All those people into romance comedy; come on board and watch this series, you will defiantly enjoy it.
I, myself am a big romance comedy fan. 
And I can proudly say thatI defiantly enjoyed this series.\n
As soon as you think it's suppose to end, another thing just pops up and extends the story even further (the usual events in an average romance anime series)\n
Since it was following that pattern, the storyline was somewhat predictable.\n
BUT\n
when you see Gouda Takeo, the anime becomes super interesting.\n
Cause it just completely destroys the normal pattern for a normal romance anime.\n
Overall, if you want to see some unique romance comedy series or you're just tired of the usual romance comedy pattern; watch this series!

I've never written a review in my entire life, but seeing some of the ratings and reviews that have shown on the front of this page, has inspired me to write one. I wholeheartedly don't understand how anyone could possibly rate this anime any lower than a 7 or an 8. 
Of course I may be biased, but this show was beautiful from start to finish. The animation was absolutely pleasing to the eyes, the music fit wonderfully in every situation, and of course the opening and ending songs/sequences were so stunning to me that I never skipped them once. 
The story is something that'scliche, sure, but it flows well. The romance is jumped into quickly, but the feelings between Takeo and Rinko slowly develop as the story goes on and gives you those warm, fuzzy feelings most people look for when watching anything with romance. 


For the characters, each has their own charm to them. I found myself loving all of their reactions, quirks, and designs; even the side characters who've only shown up two or three times have left an imprint on me. 


Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed this anime and I know for SURE, that anyone who loves the romance genre, will love this as much as I did.


Story: 9

Art: 10

Character: 9

Enjoyment: 10

Overall: 10

In all honesty I don't usually like anime as its too involved with satisfying the libido driven audience or showing japans weird kink for incest. However, this show is very different as its so fluffy and pure, it leaves a warm feeling of happiness, Our Monogatari is honestly the most tasteful anime I've ever seen as it provided a great development of the plot line without subjecting the audience to fan service - the creators of the show display great integrity as they are obviously faithful in the shows development and overall enjoyment the audience may endure. 
Basically its a good show: watch it.

Ore Monogatari is the ultimate feel good romance anime.  It's a break from the standard love triangle/trapezoids, unrequited loves, and shows that either end when the protagonists finally pair up or even end vaguely.  You're not going to see the level of drama common for the genre here.  There are no big plot twists (though plenty of pleasant surprises).  And this is exactly what I think is this story's greatest appeal:  subtlety.  Many of the episodes could be seen as downright mundane.  For example, one episode they go to the zoo.  Exciting, right?
I'll say it clearly, thisshow isn't for everyone.  If you need drama, excitement, and suspense, you'll find it lacking here.


Personally I found this to be something really special, and more often than not I was grinning like a fool from ear-to-ear or laughing out loud.  I just finished watching it a second time a month or so after my first viewing, in English this time (not typical for me but I wanted to recommend it to some friends that don't like subtitles so I checked it out and was VERY pleasantly surprised).  The interaction between Rinko and Takeo is downright sickeningly sweet most of the time.  It's like fanservice for hopeless romantics.  


But what really brings this show together for me is the characters themselves.  I'm not going to go into too much detail in what makes the individual characters unique, wouldn't do it justice if I tried.  What I will say is that the show itself is much like a relationship with a person.  It's at first taken at face value and perhaps you form opinions or ideas about the characters that are larger than life.  Then you spend more time with those characters, time in which nothing seemingly significant occurs.  But you start to notice things about them.  Like the way Rinko is sensitive to hot food.  Or how Takeo actually scares really easy in theme park horror rides.  Each piece is a tiny part of what makes that character who they are.   And the characters themselves sometimes observe these nuances about one another and appreciate those aspects of them.  That's love right there.  Taking a seemingly arbitrary, mundane aspect of a person and thinking it's cute or endearing simply because it's part of who they are and for no other deeper reason.  You start to see they do get jealous, even though they have a fairy-tale-like relationship.  They get nervous and misunderstand things and even sometimes think that maybe they aren't right for one another.  Maybe someone else that has more in common with the person I love can make them happier than I, who seems totally mismatched, can.  You start to discover that there is always something else to learn about the people in your life, no matter how long you've known them.  One of my favorite lines Takeo says regarding his best friend of over 10 years, "I know his birthday is on September 13th.  I even know what kind of underwear he wears.  But there is so much I still don't know about him."  You come to find that this larger than life guy who seems so strong is just a normal guy at heart, despite all his amazing qualities.


Sure there is some introspective discourse about love and friendship and all that.  But that isn't what really makes this show special.  It's a story that's more shown than told, through the mundane day to day relationship of a boy and a girl.  Through the friendship of two polar opposites.  It's the subtlety of it.


Now to some people, a dude is going to save a girl from a groper in the first episode and then pretty much nothing else is going to happen after that.  And they're not wrong to see it that way.  If you don't totally fall in love with this show in the first few episodes, I can pretty much guarantee it's not going to be one of your favorites.  However, I definitely like it enough to recommend anyone who's a sucker for romance give it at least a few episodes.  I just wish there was more of it.

AMAZING. Fun, quirky, cute, hilarious and a little pervy. Great for laughs. 
Cute anime to watch with a friend or lover because it is so cute and funny that you kind of want to laugh with others not just yourself. A cat will suffice, but try to watch with a human friend. I
 loved the main character because she was what many of us cute girls are! Sloppy at home but beautiful out in public. Hope that was not a spoiler! I will be recommending this anime to everyone, possibly even my dad. Please watch this anime, you will not regret it!

I think it's a sign of a masterpiece anime when there is literally nothing you would change. Unfortunately, there were a few things I would change though I still think this was great. If you want a fresh and original take on the shoujo genre this is definitely a must see. You will laugh hysterically, you would cry passionately and you will leave the series with a warm feeling that everything wrapped up nicely.
Story: 9/10
This is a slice of life so not a lot happens. There are some major plot points that happen as substantial events in Takeo's life but most of them are notterribly important. That being said, there are tons of interesting things that happen that make the story progress and the characters develop. The story has a healthy mix of fluff, heartfelt moments, hilarious moments and downright tear jerkers. It managed to cover a broad array of emotions quite well and even though there are a few plot points that droped I highly doubt you'll notice them. The story ends on a high note that wraps everything up cleanly and leaves you feeling satisfied.


Art: 8/10

This one looks very good. The character designs are unique and the art style is done quite well. There are tons of hilarious still frames of Takeo that will keep me amused for months to come.


Sound: 9/10

Thinking about "Fond memories" is making me want to cry a little right now. That song always comes in before a strong emotional moment and it never fails to disappoint. Aside from that track the OST was strong and the sound and voice acting was excellent.


Character: 9/10

The characters truly shine... every single one of them is excellent in their own way. Each of them is given a proper introduction, a fair amount of development and you can relate to all of them. Each of them was likable and there weren't any I really disliked. Granted there were some characters that were not the main focus but they did get enough attention to where you didn't forget about them. Really at the end of the day this is a love story for Yamato and Takeo and the other characters are just there to enhance the story.


Enjoyment: 9/10

I am truly sad it is over. I wish I hadn't rushed it so much, which is the strongest compliment you can give an anime.


Overall: 9/10

This is strong. If you like slice of life and unconventional romance done VERY well you will love this. I have a hard time thinking anyone would dislike this anime given how funny and interesting it is. If you haven't seen it, see it ASAP. Enjoy!

What a delight! I was reccomended this show by a friend who isn't into anime, which peaked my interest. Let me just say, the show lives up to the hype. The strongest moments for me were the spot-on character interactions and relationships. You could really feel the emotions rolling off the screen. I can't think of any qualms. I suppose the reason i gave it a 9 and not a 10 is due to the genre itself. Can't be helped i suppose. I highly encourage you to watch it, even if Shoujo isn’t your thing (i’m a Shounen girl myself). Overall, I’d say it’s apinnacle of the Shoujo genre.

Honestly, I got more than I expected out of My Love Story. I was originally a bit reluctant to give it a try due to Gouda's design, but watching the trailer and hearing the premise convinced me to give it a shot. Needless to say, I'm glad I did. My Love Story has become one of my favorite Shoujo's, and I'll explain why:
The characters: Let's start off with Gouda: the big lug is pretty damn lovable and goofy. He's obviously very different than most shoujo romance protagonists, where usually it's a very plain boy with a flexible but weak personality. Gouda's this manly guy whoactually gets along with the majority of his male classmates (who think he's the greatest) in contrast to how normally a male protagonist will have one guy friend who is usually a pervert, where as Gouda's best friend is actually quite the opposite, but we'll get to him next. He's not that smart and while he's confident in his physical capabilities lacks real confidence in himself when it comes to dealing with women, which many can relate to. 

Onto his best friend Suna, you could sort of say he's the 'expected' protagonist of the story, with a laid back and almost bland personality and a natural allure that draws women to him. I wasn't sure what to make of him at first and thought he would be boring, but he actually serves the role of best friend perfectly for the story. For one, he loves Gouda (which you'll obviously never hear him say lol) and goes out of his way to help him when he can, knowing that Gouda is pretty dense in the field of romance. People might argue against this, but I love Suna's role. Very few rom-com's, especially in anime, have a best bro role that is taken by someone who is really trying to help the main protagonist. 

Rinko is a sweetheart. Her initial infatuation with Gouda is as cute as you'd expect from a girl so tiny compared to the hulking Gouda. It's funny, because of his personality, Gouda isn't willing to put his 'selfish' desires of being closer to Rinko at the front to be respectable, so Rinko is the one who has to be 'aggressive' when it comes to this (I put quotations because the things she wants are just small things like holding hands or similar such kiddie stuff lol). Gouda is a nice guy, but he needs to catch a hint lol.


Those are the main characters at least, with a few smaller reoccurring ones that are decent but much less of the focus. I think the three of them make for a great trio in the story that doesn't involve some sort of silly love triangle. This is Gouda's love story, not the story of his fight with his best friend over a girl. 


The tone of My Love Story is generally upbeat and sweet, although some could argue that it's a bit 'too' happy. I was fine with this because I wanted to see the couple succeed, even though I would find it interesting to see what would happen if Gouda were to date one of the other few women who actually like him. 


Now that's not to say My Love Story is flawless. Because of the strength in their relationship with one another, it's hard for there to be any true stakes when it comes to the drama. You have a couple times where the couple is faced with an outsider who is attracted to one of the two, but it's easy to tell what choice they will make. If anything, you could almost say that My Love Story is too 'pure', as previously said before. This wasn't a problem for me but I can see why it would be a problem for watchers looking for something with more conflict. 


All in all, My Love Story is honestly one of my favorite anime. It might not be a five start for everyone, but if you want a sweet story with a sweet couple, give My Love Story a shot.

My love story is a cute little show where every episode is enjoyable and pretty funny but doesn't delve any deeper than that
Story 6: The main story of this show concludes in the first 6 or so episodes and the rest of it is basically just the main characters going around doing stupid shit. Random dramatic plot devices are shoved in and barely mentioned again in the span of one or two episodes. The plot is not really important.
Art 8: The art in this show is very basic but very well done. It has some slight cutesy twists to the standard format but besides thatit is your typical post 2010 clean anime art style.


Sound 7: The sound design is well done but nothing amazing. Voice acting is on the above average side and the OST is also enjoyable. 


Character 8: There aren't many characters in this show but the ones in it play off each other well and are the entire plot of the show.


Enjoyment 9: I feel like I enjoyed this more than I should have. I watched it with my girlfriend over a decent period of time. It was a show that we could sit down, watch a couple episodes and they are all equally as enjoyable. I could imagine it could get stale at 24 episodes if you tried to watch it quickly but if you just watch it every once in a while it is a good time.


Overall 8: Cute show with a negligible plot. Watch it while spooning your sweetie.

This probably won't be much of a reliable review since I fall apart just thinking about this anime haha.
WHEN I FIRST started watching this or saw it at a quick glimpse, I thought it was a romance that would drag on throughout the entire season. 
Admit it, we've all seen romances where the main heroine takes the entire season to confess to her crush. It is different in this anime. She confesses to him soon after their encounter, and this is where the story begins. Now before you go and knit-pick for her confessing only after they've met, some people need to understand that thisis a SHOUJO anime with a simple 24 episodes !!! It is based off of their development as a couple than how they met, but they continue to grow as characters and that is what I find so likable about it. 


You'd also think that there would be misunderstandings, given that the protagonist is telling his love story as the title states - and his best friend is the best looking guy at school. But NO, thank the lord, there are barely any misunderstandings unlike a lot of dramatic romances. Unless you live for that, this anime might not be suitable for you. Each episode kind of represents something new he learns in a relationship AND as a person.


One of my favorite things about this show is that ALL of the characters have room for development, and his handsome best friend is not just a simple side character. Not many of the characters are there just to fill the space. They were all given screen time and romance was approached in different ways here.


Overall: It is a cute show with the most precious characters *-* Something that really held it down was their friendship (sorry, not so good with names) - It was simple and fun to watch.

This type of anime is what Romance should really be about. I will remember this anime for the rest of my life because it showed how to treat girls not just the right way but literally the perfect way. The realism was present throughout the entire show, even in Takeo. There are people that think they are too big or too ugly to get a girl and are contempt with it. Those people are also the most humble, loving, and respectful kind of people. This show breaks the barrier of looking past looks and into what love really is about. Personality, emotions, understanding each other,these have all been covered over and over again to form a beautiful relationship that I'm sure everyone dreams of having. Out of Romance anime this is by far my favorite because it can build the self confidence of some guys that deserve to have this kind of relationship.

Ore Monogatari follows Takeo a very interesting character a very big ogre like boy in high school being so big he scares a lot of people. But in reality he is about as soft as a teddy bear. Everyone who knows him always likes him, unfortunately due to his large size he doesn't really have luck with girls. His best friend Makoto is the total opposite they have been friends since they were kids and they have grew up next door. Makoto is a cool, collected, smart, and handsome young man. So there friendship is a bit odd but none the less they are thebest of friends. It makes Takeo a little upset that every girl he ends up liking always likes Makoto or is saying stuff behind Takeo back. This is until one day on a train ride Takeo sees this girl and this creepy groper feeling her up and he jumps in and saves her. Think girl winds up being Rinko Yamato a beautiful, shy, and very tiny and cute girl. So again the total opposite of Takeo but at the first sight of Takeo she saw the good in him and fell in love with him. At the same time Takeo falls in love with this girl after saving her Takeo is in to very cute girls so she is exactly the type of girl he is looking for. Unfortunately they are both scared and nervous Rinko thinks he is totally awesome totally the coolest and that all the girls must be all over him. And Takeo thinks she must like Makoto from the way she looks at him. But this look is just because she is too embarrassed to look at Takeo. This is until one day Takeo is with Makoto and Rinko is coming over and Takeo hides under the bed and Makoto gets Rinko to admit she has feelings for Takeo and then Takeo pops out and says he has feelings for her too. This is a beautiful love story between two high school kids who are total opposites. I honestly thought this was such a beautiful amazing romance. With two people that are totally different and setting aside there differences and loving each other for who they really are and this honestly blew me away.\n

I will try to keep this review spoiler free as much as possible but do take care if I slip somewhere that you received this warning at the beginning.  
I saw this anime 3 times until now and it brakes my heart to see this anime ranked so low and get such reviews but I won't judge other people's opinion, as much as I would like to; instead I will just give my own and try to explain to the best of my ability why I think this is a great anime. 
Story.....10.
 I guess anything cute will cause some people in our daysto gouge their eyes out without considering the packaging. I, on the other hand consider the way it's done and the packaging before dismissing something just because it's overly "kawai" in some people's opinion. On this occasion even dough the story is so sweet it can give you diabetes it so well presented and paced in such a way that you will only crave for more. The romance and the bromance in this anime is some of the best I've ever seen, with the red and blue ogres mini story complimenting it perfectly. 


Characters.....10

I absolutely love the characters in this anime. Are you looking for realism? Then you can go watch a documentary or shitty dating show on TV. This anime does not boast realism in the way the character handle the relationship but it makes us want to be there, at least that's how I felt. I for one don't watch anime or movies for realism, I face reality everyday outside of those. I watch anime to immerse myself in a better world, to see how would things be if a romance would be this pure and beautiful, or a friendship between two guys can be this hearth-worming. I love the misunderstandings between the characters and they way they clear them. I also like the main character interior monologues.  His voice seems perfect to be the narrator of his own life.  


Animation.....8

Well the animation is not perfect but it's enough for this anime that it shouldn't bother you in the least. I admit I might be biased in this category as I rank animation the lowest when it comes to any entertainment medium. It's the same with games, do we care that much for the graphics to the detriment of the game? Maybe some people do but I think that's a wrong way to see things. And I think many people agree with me seeing the rise of the indie games that don't have the triple a graphics of normal release but is far more enjoyable. The same goes for anime. Just because guilty crown had some very impressive animation, specially for it's time, that doesn't mean the anime wasn't extremely bad in my opinion. I'm not going to say that you can be extremely lazy and don't even bother coloring half the things in your anime (Acchi Kocchi) and call it artist choice you can have fairly good animation for the type of anime you are presenting. That's enough for me.


Music....8

The sound is just like the animation nothing to write home about but it's in no way horrible or not in tune with the anime. It does well to compliment the atmosphere of a relaxed conversation in a relaxed world. It just put's you in a chill mood which fits the anime perfectly. The piano score for allot of the adorable situations is so endearing. 


Overall Enjoyment....10

You can tell can't you? You can tell I love this anime. I am the type to re-watch the shows that I like over and over again and seeing how I already saw this 3 times and it's so recent, I just adore this anime. If I ever need my fix of a cute and adorable romance, a wonderful friendship, an anime that makes your worries go away, this is the one for me. Here's hoping I see more of these types of anime. 


My recommendation is to go watch this anime and try to look past your own misconceptions of cute and adorable things are "meh" because it'a all in how it's done that makes something great.

Madhouse nevers disappoints, they can make a good show in every genre that exist, seriously is like they can't make a bad show xD.

I seriously think this show is a enjoyable one, is awesome, fun, romantic and with good character, i know that not everyone likes shoujo but is you're looking for a good one you might wanna wacht this :p

My Love Story focuses on the relationship developments between the big and intimidating Takeo and the beauty Rinko, whom Takeo saves from a molester aboard a train. Like Kare Kano, My Love Story sticks out from many romance anime in that rather than build up to our main couple eventually confessing to one another and starting up their relationship by late in the show's run, the couple confess and start up their relationship early in the series thus focus is then devoted to exploring the developments in their relationship. The series takes its time in slowly developing our main couple's relationship that include going tothe beach together for the first time, their first kiss, and the first test in commitment to their relationship.


While it is admirable that My Love Story's premise sticks out quite prominently for a romance title, it does have a major flaw for me in the fact that the individuals making our main relationship don't have much going for them in the way of depth. Takeo is your archetypal imposing male lead in terms of appearance while having a sweeter side, and Rinko is not much better beyond being your beautiful and kind female lead. As there is not much to the couple in regards to personality and depth, this made it hard for me to care much for their relationship developments in spite of its premise sticking out from the norm for your typical romance title. The remaining characters in the series are not better in this regard as many of them also follow archetypes typical of high school themed anime and had little for me to grab my interest for them.


The visuals to the series stick out prominently with its beautiful scenic shots, bright and vivid color, and well-detailed character and object designs. Food admirers might find themselves foaming from the mouth in seeing the nicely drawn cakes and pastries that are often made by Rinko whenever she meets up with Takeo, adding further to the great presentation of this series.


Still in spite of its visuals and somewhat fresh premise, My Love Story is a tricky series for me to want to recommend. Our main couple doesn't get much in the way of fleshing out and the so-called pureness of their relationship felt a bit saccharine for me at a number of points throughout the show's run. While it is considered one of 2015's top titles by anime fans, your mileage may vary with how well you perceive it.

I believe this anime is for a certain type of character in a person.  The type of character that takes things as they come and is a friendly lad or gal.  The repeated lovely emotions in the anime are amazing because they are consistent.  These emotions are so consistent that at more than one point I had thought to myself that the emotions should differ.  That somebody should get angry or upset.  But then I'd think to myself, does that really have to happen? Can we take these days as being awesome without putting up a fuss about it?I say, yah we can.


One thing that I especially loved about Ore Monogatari is the highly expressive emotions coming from all sets of characters.  This anime really gets into the minds of characters and portrays their mindset via actions and/or words.  Most characters are unique and some are placed for comical purposes.  This anime really takes the viewer on an emotional ride.


Another important aspect about this anime is that the main characters go through troubling times.  Times in-where they have to depend on their friends because they are not strong enough to resolve the situation on their own.  And also, times when they must be stronger than their friends in order to help them through their hardships.  I really enjoyed the special moments in this anime and some days these episodes would end much faster than I expected.  One minute I'd be laughing, and the next I'd see an image of the stars with heartening end-music in the background.


A lot of things were done well here, and I don't see much of a point stating out the flaws in this anime, because honestly they aren't worth mentioning.  Not if its going to steal away the light from the good times.


Here are the ratings:

Story - 9 - What they did right within this anime is to have detailed mini-stories placed within each episode.  Yes this is a slice of life, but the purpose of each story keeps the viewer enthralled and waiting to see how the story ends.

Art - 10 - The graphics are well animated and certain events cause for dynamic and unexpected animations to occur, specifically within the visages of the characters themselves.  All characters are well expressed.

Sound - 10 - Very soothing and cheery sound effects & background music.  Also, well placed gloomy songs to hit the feels when the time is right.

Characters - 10 - By now, it should be a given that the characters are well drawn and well animated.


Overall - 10 - Well done.  Another 10 for my list.

Recommended - Highly recommended to those looking for a romance anime.

Hey folks, this will be a review for Ore Monogatari!!. I'm a bit late to this party, but it still seems like it was worth showing up to. I do have some complaints, but overall its a really fun, cute and relaxing show and I do recommend it.
The story is something that I believe won this show so much fame. Unlike many romance shows, Ore Monogatari has the two characters in a relationship for most of the show. Most of the show after the first four or so episodes is dedicated to small things like building up courage to hold hands, trips to various places,misunderstandings and all the small semi dramatic things you can think of to spice up the show.


The art was great. It took me so long to try the show because of how Takeo looked in the cover image. However the art style is awesome and even the look of Takeo adds some extra points for the show. The soundtrack was equally as good.


The characters were fun and interesting. Takeo being the big, gorilla like main character adds a lot of comedy and understandable misunderstanding to the show. His best friend Sunakawa seems like hes the cool and popular type, but he plays it completely different. He is more of the intellectual side of Takeo, supporting him from the shadows. Yamato is the love interest, and she is the cutest thing you will ever see. She loves pastries, and Takeo, seems a little dim, and also has normal human interests. 


There are plenty of side characters, but many are there for the added lite drama or just to spice up the show and not really worth noting.


I enjoyed this show a lot. However I now understand why so many Harems, and romance shows hold off on the actual coupling of the characters. Though its frustrating to watch as they dance around one another without progression, its equally frustrating to have nothing to look forward to. In all honesty this show didn't need to be 24 episodes long. 12 episodes would have been enough to cover most of the really good episodes and cut out the frankly boring filler. The characters were interesting but once you got to know them, their antics and humor seemed a bit forced and dry. This didn't ruin the show though, its really fun and a good break from the the crap.


TLDR: Funny, cute, actually show about a couple. 24 episodes was a bit much, filler episodes can get boring. Recommend to anyone who like romance and good characters.

There are almost no words to describe how much I loved this anime! I just loved it so much! The story was so full on innocence and genuine love. I loved how there was much more comedy that drama in this anime. It when out of the stereotype of shoujo anime. The art was amazing, and adorable. Yamoto was adorable and the height difference between her and Takeo was hilarious just as it was cute. There wasn't much to say about the sound, but it was very good and the opening was just too cute! The character development was wonderful, mostly in Suna. You'd thinkthat he is a cold, quite guy. But you see a caring, warm side of him and you find out that is not that perfect nor normal. I found myself laughing for 10 minutes straight at times. I enjoyed this anime and found it quite refreshing. Overall I give it a 10, and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to start watching anime.

Ore Monogatari is about Gouda Takeo, a big guy who has a hard time getting a girl couse they all fall for his best friend. One day he'll save a girl from a stalker and she'll fall in love with him.
I'm not really into shoujos (as you can tell by my review of Akagami No Shirayuki-hime) BUT Ore Monogatari innovated the genre by not using the "super-hot-and-perfect male protagonists" gliche and that is areally daring thing to do since most girls love that kind of animes couse of those hunks. This series is a wonderful love story and a great comedy too! The ending justmelted my heart, I really recommend this anime to everyone who's into heart-warming love stories with great humor. I really would've liked it more if it wasn't that slow... but hey... It's a shoujo after all.
